snippet: Lt. Col. William Helixon, the Army prosecutor, left the closely watched case less than a month before the scheduled court-martial of Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair on sexual assault charges.
abstract: Lead Army prosecutor Lt Col William Helixon abruptly departs from closely watched sexual misconduct case less than a month before the scheduled court-martial of Brig Gen Jeffrey A Sinclair on sexual assault charges; departure comes just days after defense lawyers said in interviews that Helixon told them he had come to believe a jury would not believe the testimony of the prosecution’s chief witness.
lead_paragraph: Lt. Col. William Helixon, the Army prosecutor, left the closely watched case less than a month before the scheduled court-martial of Brig. Gen. Jeffrey A. Sinclair on sexual assault charges.

headline.main: Lead Prosecutor’s Abrupt Departure Rattles a Military Sexual Assault Case
headline.print_headline: Lead Prosecutor’s Abrupt Departure Rattles a Military Sexual Assault Case

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
